# Diodes

- A  __diode __ is a  __semiconductor __ device that allows electrical current to flow in one direction only\.
- The diode has two terminals\, called the  __anode __ and the  __cathode__ \.
- A ring mark on the diode case identifies the terminal corresponding to the cathode\.
- The other terminal corresponds to the anode\.
- The diode consists of two layers of semiconducting material:

  * A   __P\-type __  semiconductor layer containing positive charge carriers \(holes\)\.  The P\-type layer corresponds to the anode \(A\) terminal of the     diode\.
  * An   __N\-type__    __ __  semiconductor layer containing negative charge carriers \(electrons\)\.  The N\-type layer corresponds to the cathode \(K\) terminal of the     diode  \.

 __Recall: Operation__ 

When no voltage is present across the diode terminals\, the diode is in the “off” \(blocked\) state\. No current flows through the diode\, and the diode acts like an   __open switch__  \.

When   voltage at the anode is lower than the voltage at the cathode \, the diode is said to be   __reverse biased\. __  Diode still acts as an open switch and no current flows through the diode\.

When the voltage at the anode is higher than the voltage at the cathode \, diode is said to be   __forward biased\. __  Diode acts as a closed switch\, allowing the current to flow from the anode to the cathode\.

# Diodes Circuits Analysis

 __Load__       __Line__    __  __    __Analysis:__ 

The operating point of a diode can be determined by a  load\-line analysis  of the voltage\-current characteristic\.

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_8.jpg)

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_9.png)

Determine Point A\, where no current is flowing through the diode\. \(diode open\)

Determine Point B\, where no voltage drop across the diode\. \(diode closed\)

Construct  Load Line  by connecting the two points\.

Operating point \(Q\-point\)  is given by the intersection of the load line and the diode characteristic\.

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_10.jpg)

L  oad line is determined   by   the    applied   network\,   whereas   the   diode   characteristics  are   defined by   the   selected     device\.

Q\- point   is the   quiescent   operating point\.

::: {.notes}
